Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Girls H
Reviews.Content: Our experience in this hotel was amazing, nice and old hotel , typical french , next from The Champs , everything was perfect , we felt like important persons . Good room , very quiet , and the service was wonderful , Nooreen was very helpul and friendly , she welcomed us like " queens " , during our check-in but also during our check-out , all the staff was smile and happy to do their job , Many thanks .

Reviews.Title: “A great, central city Hotel”
Reviews.Author: K V
Reviews.Content: A great Hotel if you are wanting to be close to the centre of Paris. Only a 5 min walk to the Champs Elysees and less than a 5 min walk to the nearest metro stop. The Hotel is easy to find and the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms are nice and clean and have everything you need for your stay, with great lounge areas downstairs to use also. Would recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: DXB2GB
Reviews.Content: Positives: great location friendly staff clean room good size room Negatives: breakfast was basic no gym no room service

Reviews.Title: “A great weekend”
Reviews.Author: Jim D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to all the amenities and is great vaue for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H
Reviews.Content: Very charming hotel in the perfect location near the Champs Elysees! The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was cute and clean. Would love to stay there again on my next weekend in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel / A real jewel”
Reviews.Author: Claraoneilli
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel with is very welcoming . excellent location . The staff is very friendly and attentive . The staff speaks great english. Helene member of staff of the breakfast department is very nice and efficient. She is a great worker. The rooms are beautifully decorated. And we would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Nikkeboentje
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were moved to this hotel at short notice as its sister hotel had messed up our booking. It was a rugby weekend and we thought it would be difficult to find anywhere else so we didn't complain. The hotel is in a good location, very close to the metro station. The immediate area around the hotel was very quiet and most shops and restaurants were closed on Sat and Sun. However less than a 5 minute walk away is all the hustle and bussle. Apart from one other guest, we may have been the only other guests in the hotel so it was very quiet. The rooms are lovely, nice size with everything you need. Free wifi. The bathroom had lovely toiletries and fluffy towels. The room was a bit hot and I had to open the window during the night to cool it down. We didn't have breakfast At the hotel (combination of a late night and being hungover) although we we did check out there was an area that had tea, coffee, water, juices etc which was very welcomed. I definitely would think about staying here again if I could get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: MavDubai
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel in a superb location! Just parallel to the Champs Elysees, it was just a 2 minute walk to the main avenue. The staff was very friendly and helpful. However, the breakfast was ok with not much variety. The room was a also bit small but that's Paris. Can't say much about the cleaning standards. Didn't seem like the room got vaccummed or dusted during our stay!

Reviews.Title: “An Old hotel , for a couple hours stay”
Reviews.Author: Abdallah6666
Reviews.Content: The room is very old , Hasn't get bidet at the bathroom , the walls are light which the sound outside could be heard from inside .

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Sub4miler
Reviews.Content: Friendly staffs, great location, clean, big room for its location and price, enough said? By he way, don't even try their sister hotel Le 123, only 10 euro cheaper, a world of difference. I stayed in both, I thought 100 meter from each other, and 10 euro can add up. What a mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good room”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: Just stayed the one night. Room was spotless and comfortable. Close to Champs Elysee and metro. No evening dining, but restaurants nearby, including an English pub 200 yards away (no English in it except behind the bar!). Breakfast reasonable but not a large selection, especially if you like a hot breakfast. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice value for money hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: SpirosKo
Reviews.Content: Very good location, very close to the Champs Elysee. Very helpful staff, they offered to help with every request I had. The ground floor rooms are very noisy due to being very close to the kitchen, the entrance of the hotel and the street. The view from the 6th floor room window to the Eiffel Tower (where I was transferred after complaining about the noise) was very nice. Internet connection was also an issue (very slow). For someone that is there for business purposes it is a very big issue. Good value for money, but wouldn't recommend for business purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: pierotlunaire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times on business. Nice rooms, particularly if you can get an executive room. Quiet location, although rather thin walls can transmit noise. Very pleasant staff. Complementary wifi. Best to book breakfast in the room price. Looking forward to visiting with my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, spacious and tastefully refurbished hotel in the centre of paris”
Reviews.Author: DelftseSAPer
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here on a business trip. They have a relation with 123 elysee around the corner. You can see this in the style: a tastefull mix between old and new. The room I had was unusually big for this kind of hotel. The room was clean, hip and nicely furbished. Good breakfast, beautifull elevator!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireSue
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel as soon as I walked in. Very stylish, great location ... and spotted a fabulous cake shop on the way in the cab! The room was lovey - comfortable bed, nicely decorated, lovely bathroom with bathrobe. And the cake shop was, indeed fabulous. I stayed for one night on business and ate a lovely salad and desert from there. Though the room service menu for the hotel was extensive and tempting. Overall, really enjoyed my stay and for once wished I wasn't on business and my other half had been with me. It felt like the perfect kind of setting for a wonderful break in Paris. TIP: Do check out the cake shop! Straight around the corner, fabulous cakes and there were queues of people buying bread.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,, great staff, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: Great location, good value for money for business travellers. Staff is very nice, and the rooms were clean and decent

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous break at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clare M
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a lovely break in Paris. This hotel is perfectly placed for the Champs Elysees and central Paris. On arrival at the hotel, check in was both welcoming and efficient. The room (No 45) was spacious, clean and decorated to a high standard - and the balcony was a bonus. Breakfast although 15 Euro's per person was of a high quality and plenty to keep you going for the day! from Cereals, fruit to a cooked breakfast ! I would not hesitate to return to this high quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doris050
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband and parents for a special occasion and could not fault the hotel at all. We were up-graded on arrival, but even the standard rooms are fantastic. The reception staff are extremely friendly and helpful and couldn't do enough for us. The hotel has recently been renovated to a high standard and comes top for cleanliness. I have stayed in city hotels before and the size of the rooms in this one far exceed what I expected. The only slight down side is the size of the breakfast room is not really sufficient for the number of guests, so either eat early or be prepared to wait. The quality of the breakfast though is great. The hotel is literally a 5 minute walk from the centre point of the Champs Elysees yet at night is surpirsingly quiet so no problem sleeping once you have had enough of the cuty night life. All in all a fantastic hotel which I will definitely use again!

Reviews.Title: “*LOVELY HOTEL*”
Reviews.Author: Helena90
Reviews.Content: All you need to know about this hotel - Great location, close to the Champs-Elysees but without the noise, walking distance to all the major attractions, lots of great shops and restaurants (check out The Music Hall - just round the corner), AMAZING cake shop (Dalloyau) about 5 mins away. Staff were excellent and very accommodating...complimentary hot drinks on demand, booked a restaurant reservation for us, and brought up an ironing board and iron within 2 minutes of request. Very clean. Large rooms. Comfy bed. Lovelydecor. Would definitely return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely presented hotel in quiet street, but some drawbacks.”
Reviews.Author: Me-from-the-UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and well presented. The public rooms and our room had clearly been recently decorated. The entrance hall, and the quirky lift, give a good first impression. The room itself was smaller than we expected. The air conditioning was not working. The shower drain emitted bad smells. The walls were very thin, meaning that even quiet conversation was heard in the next room. We asked for a non-smoking room in the reservation, but the room we got had an ashtray and complimentary matches. I don't know what the breakfast was like - we were too horrifed at the price (21 euros per person) to try it. Some staff were helpful, some less so. We had trouble with the magnetic keycards, on 2 different occasions. The first time they were recoded with apologies and no fuss, while the second time a different person implied that this was all our fault for keeping them in the same pocket as coins or mobile phones (we didn't). The local neighbourhood becomes deserted in the evening, and most of the nearby bars and cafes close in the early evening - and don't even open on Saturday or Sunday. When travelling on the metro, we often found that the line with a station very close didn't actually take us to any of the sites we wanted to see, and we always had to change. All in all, unless you specifically want to be in this area or hotel, as a tourist it might be better to try one in an area of town where there is a bigger selection of places that are open in the evening or weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Staff, Chic Decor, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BLinFlorence
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely Valentine's day weekend at the Bradford Elysees. The staff was very helpful and recommended the perfect restaurant for us, in walking distance to the hotel, for valentine's day (La Boeuf sur Le Toit). The hotel decor was charming and chic. Everything was very clean and new with an old world Parisian charm. The hotel is in a great location, very central, within a minutes walk from a well connected tube and just a few more minutes to the champs elysees, but not located on such a loud, busy street that you couldn't sleep with the windows open if you wanted to. Complementary, or even affordable breakfast would have been appreciated, as breakfast at the hotel was 21 euro pp, but it was easy to find cafes and a starbucks very nearby for a morning fix. I would also check the room dimensions before booking and make sure you're aware of the size you're getting, as ours was slightly smaller than expected, but still very nice. Apparently hotel rooms in paris tend to be on the small side in general. Also, our room was uncomfortably warm the first night but, like I said, sleeping with the windows open was not too troubling.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, huge beautiful rooms and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Travelinggal74
Reviews.Content: Recommend anyone to stay at this hotel when in Paris, it is wonderful and we will surely return. Located just a few minutes walk from the Champs Elysees, we were within walking distance to many sights, stores/shopping and restaurants. If you want to experience a little Parisian flair, this hotel is the best place for it. The hotel is in a Haussmann building retaining many of its old features, including the wonderful cage lift and spiral staircase. Attention to detail is a priority at this hotel, illustrated by the artwork throughout the hotel, and the books in the lobby. We spent six nights here, and had a most enjoyable stay. I have always been wowed by many hotel lobbies only to be disappointed once I got to the room. Thankfully, this was not the case with the Hotel Bradford - the room was wonderful! We were very impressed with everything - the room was huge and included a sitting area with fireplace and two balconies. Most comfortable bed and pillows, and overall the room was very clean. I was travelling with my mother who is a clean-freak, and she was most impressed with housekeeping. The bathroom was lovely too with great water pressure (never ending hot water) and a towel rack which was heated. We had a little problem with people staying in the next room on two of the nights, as you could hear everything and it did not help that they were very loud also playing music until 2AM. This is not the fault of the hotel, although it seems our room was an adjoining one with a communal door so perhaps was not as isolated as other rooms in the hotel. After being kept awake the first night, we spoke to reception the next evening when it seemed the noise levels were going to continue. They dealt with the situation very promptly, speaking to the guests in the next room and the issue was solved. For this we were very grateful, as the staff responded quickly to resolve our concerns and followed up with us to ensure we were happy. Service is excellent and all the staff members we dealt with were efficient, helpful and always smiling. They provided us with a map of Paris, printed boarding passes and also booked taxis for us. We didn't try the breakfast, following the other reviews we read, and instead enjoyed daily treats from the neighbouring patisseries. We probably spent about 8-10 Euros a day for breakfast each, but in most cases we had lots of left over treats to take us through to lunch as well. So would recommend trying as many different patisseries in the area, we liked Julien's for the delicious fig rolls. The weather was below zero during our stay, snowy and raining, but the hotel was so warm and comforting. The only thing the hotel didn't have was umbrellas for the guests to use. This is an amazing four-star hotel, great value for the location and highly recommended. Also free highspeed wi-fi in the room was a bonus too. Don't miss sampling the hot chocolate and macaroons at Laduree on Champs Elyesses, or the Christmas Village if you are visiting during this time. Paris is a truly beautiful city, and our stay was enhanced by the wonderful experience at Hotel Bradford. Stay here - you won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Chic stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SusanneTD
Reviews.Content: Look no further! very chic hotel in Paris! We were there for fashion week in paris, and many from Stella McCartney etc stayed there for the weekend=) Good Location, only 4 min walk to Champs-elysees.. And 5 min walk to Avenue Montagne with fashion stores. the staff was helpful with taxi, briefcase, coffe and the on the house and with recomending restaurants and things to see.. next time im off to a weekend in paris i know where to stay=)

Reviews.Title: “wonderful days,wonderful holiday”
Reviews.Author: anitaBucharest
Reviews.Content: We was absolutely satisfied about what we find in this hotel:location is perfect for walking or metro,the place is perfect for night sleeping,in the same time in 5 min. you can be in the most popular avenue in the world.All the people we meet in hotel made us feeling good,in this point I have to congratulate Mrs.Renault,the manager of hotel.This Lady made us an unforgetable vacation in Paris!Thanks!The rooms we had were perfect,large,lightly,very nice decoration, flowers in the windows and very,very clean.The breakfast was a happy time in a very calm and nice atmosphere.The top mark for hotel atmosphere,it was a pleasure to enjoy about all details.This location made us happy to think about next visit in wonderfull Paris and stay in the same hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Michbain
Reviews.Content: Good Location, but definetly is not a 4 stars hotel, if you have allergies to strong odors, do not stay in this hotel, I dont know what they use to clean but there is a strong perfume that turned on my allergies in a bad way. Excellente breakfast but so expensive, good service from polite and nice employees. I know everything in Paris is expensive but I expect a little more for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Once upon a time there was the "good value for money" Brdaford Elysées!!”
Reviews.Author: MaximilianBerni
Reviews.Content: I used to stay many and many times a year at this hotel, conveniently located to all the fashion shworooms I work with (YSL is just next door!), and usually I never had any complaint about my frequent stays. Now, I actually have to complain about a lot of things, while staying at this hotel. As somebody else already said, the staff at night is very rude (many times there were young guysat the reception, with no skills at all, only busy in listening to their i-pod, who couldn't answer even only one question!) Furthermore, I once had a problem with the bathroom (no hot water at all...and I just got my room after the flight) and the same young guy at the reception told me I had no other chance till the morning after..everything was fully-booked; once I told him I could leave my room because of that problem, he said he was fine....(unbelievably rude!!!). Then again, I had reserved in advance one room in particular, but at my arrival the front desk said it was not possible for me to get that room, because they were still doing refurbishment of it....;a few hours later, while taking the elevator,a couple of customers came out of the same room I had previously booked (I got a smaller one on the same floor that time)...and I asked them if the room had some "work in progress" inside...and they answered it was perfect and they gave them that room at their arrival...(and it was their first they stay at Bradford hotel...) while I actually was staying there every 3 months,every year!. I think that all of this is too much to handle,without complaining. Furthermore, after the refurbishments they got (so many times I stayed there and all the windows could not be open due to those works, undergone for more than 2 years) the price of stay has grown more than 3 times the price list they had till last spring 2010...and the rooms are always the same...except from the furniture, which had obviously to be changed from years! I always tend to be really honest while reporting my stays, no fake complaints, and I often travel worldwide for work; every time I stay at a hotel where I usually go for work , no matter where, the director or the front desk always try to give me a very good accomodation, because they know me and they are glad I come back at the same hotel every time....at Bradford it never happened...I don't know why...the only person who always cared about my stays was Fredricat the front desk..and I'll always thank him for it! I know that rooms at the Bradford are not that small for a hotel in Paris......but next time I'd rather stay at Hotel Murano for the same price!...and let's not talk about the breakfast and the price of it!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great value, excellent location in paris”
Reviews.Author: Blerke
Reviews.Content: We had 2 standard doubles 54 & 58. We had read that you didnt get much space in paris, this was not the case with these rooms, they were very spacious, 54 had a sitting room area. Bathrooms were big and each room had 2 balconies with views of the eiffel tower. Everywhere was clean and facilities good , free wifi, but you need to request tea and coffee making facilities. Theyre free but not there automatically. Everywhere was walkable, champs elysee just a street away, eiffel tower pleasant walk 20 mins away, louvre 30 mins through the tuileries taking in place de la concorde, point alexandre 3rd. Some noise from neighbours experienced from both rooms but not annoying enough to stop us returning. Bit of a problem with "antique" lift, out of order twice during our 3 day visit, when you have to walk up 5 floors as we did a few times. If youre elderly of infirm get a lower floor. Staff could be more friendly, we'd just stayed in Hotel Angleterre in Grenoble who were significantly better. Caroline was the best we came across for being more helpful and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: zilbi
Reviews.Content: We were there for a family vacation on May this year with our young child (11) and our daughter (19). The hotel location is great, just walking distance from the lively Champs Elysees (not far from Arc de Triumph). Quiet surrounding. The rooms are big and comfortable and very clean. The crew was very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Ronfromvirginia
Reviews.Content: Reserved two rooms, one double for my wife and I and one twin bedded room for our 11 year old son and his grandmother. When we arrived, they twin bedded room had only one twin bed and had been assigned to my wife and I. Our son and my wife's mother had been assigned to the room with the double bed. The front desk person was no help and refused to let me see the reservation she said we made for a room with one twin bed. I was not allowed to see it she said. Fortunately, cooler heads prevailed and another person arrived who had some authority and straightened out the situation. My wife and I were assigned the double and a room with twin beds was found for our son and his grandmother. The rest of our stay was fine. Rooms are small but that adds to the charm of this hotel. Breakfast was not included with the room charge and was expensive for what little was offered. Fortunately, there are several reasonably priced opportunities for breakfast nearby. The hotel is perfectly situated two blocks off the Champs Elysees. Away from the crowds and convenient to just about everything one would want to see in Paris. It is in an area with many small restaurants favored by the locals. Food in the area was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and good value for dollar”
Reviews.Author: Terisa N
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel through a travel website versus directly through the hotel after reading that breakfast can be included if you book it correctly. The hotel was very easy to find and it was really easy to walk to everything from the hotel. Metro stops are just a few minutes walking distance in two different directions. We often cut through the covered inside walkway in a shopping "mall" (near the Marriott) and it took us right onto the Champs easily. We actually enjoyed late nights out so we were never up early enough to try the included breakfast. We saw the tail end of it one morning and it looked like an average "continental" type breakfast. When we arrived at the hotel to check in, our room was not ready. Granted, we were early so we left bags and strolled. We were told to check back in an hour or so, but even then, still not ready. Two hours later and a meal eaten nearby, still not ready. We finally sat in the waiting area for a few more minutes and THEN our room was ready. Our room was nice, we could actually see the very top of the Eiffel Tower from our bathroom looking out the doors to the small balcony. Our only complaints: 1) the closet would NOT unlock for us no matter how much we jiggled the key. We finally had to call the manager and he struggled a while before getting it open. 2) We returned from a day out and about to find our room door propped open with a door stop. Apparently the housekeeper just forgot and left our room open when done. Luckily, nothing was missing. 3) The staff just could not offer good suggestions and help with things to do in the area. We utilized staff at the Marriott desk instead since they were far more helpful (on the advice of friends). Overall, a good experience, great location for far less money than staying on the main street, and very easy to get to everything. Appreciate the small lift to assist with luggage also! No lounge or bar or anything like that.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality, Authenticity, and Value”
Reviews.Author: bbuchanan65
Reviews.Content: Its very close to the subway and champs-elysees. These folks were super professional. Helped with more details of my stay, touring the city, an dhelping me make my early morning flight. It seemed a bit small, but had my own clean bathroom, and once i ventured out to the balcony, I could see why. It was such a view and such beauty. I'll use Bradford Elysees everytiem I go to Paris ! if you like nightlife, go to the queen on champs-elysees.

Reviews.Title: “BW Bradford Elysee A++”
Reviews.Author: Mllto
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed there for 5 days. We had a room on the 6th floor which appears to have been recently remodeled. The room was large, extremely clean & comfortable. The bathroom was equally large & clean......updated. The staff was nice & friendly. The location was excellent, close to everything & in a safe area. I will return when in Paris. The only thing that would improve the hotel would be a bar ... it didnt have one. There is however an excellent English pub accross the street.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure the "Premier" status is appropriate.”
Reviews.Author: PaulT73
Reviews.Content: Firstly this is a very good hotel, the service is exceptionally good, the hotel was a lot more compact than I was expecting and lacked facilities I would have assumed to have found in a "Premier" hotel. The rooms are quite small but comfortable enough, although the street outside can be quite noisy (but that is hardly the fault of the hotel)> I would and will stay here again, but I would not recommend staying any longer than a couple of nights maximum.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again!!!”
Reviews.Author: rebeccasordo
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel that was in a great location. We walked to everything but the metro is very close as well. The hotel was quiet, comfortable, clean. The room was very nice with flat screen tv, english channels and the bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was great and included in our stay. The people were very helpful and the price was great for this ideal location! We would stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Huge and immaculate rooms: my favorite hotel in Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: MaximilianBerni
Reviews.Content: I use to stay at this hotel every season, since 2006.I work in fashion and this hotel is the best spot in Paris.First: it's close to main shoppping areas;Second: it's also close to all the most important showroom for fashion world; Third: all rooms are really spacious and very clean (you know that spacious and spotless rooms are such a difficult thing to find in Paris,even in a 5 stars Deluxe hotel, trust me!!!) People at the reception are always fast and very helpful.They gave me every time a wonderful room. When they were having a refurbishment,some months ago, they gave me a room on the upper floors,which was more "away" from the noise of construction people working there.I have to thank them for that....sleep is very important for me,while I'm in Paris!I use to book this hotel for my collegues too, when we come to Paris. I definitely recommend this hotel to everybody now, and will recommend it in future times too.Thank you guys at Bradford Elysées

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Ramsden
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, we had a really good stay. The hotel is well located, about 5 mins off the Champs Elysees. It's a little hard to find at first, being on a maze of back streets, but once you get your bearings, it's a great location. Try turning right at Monoprix, then left up Rue Artois and the hotel is on your right. Our room (68) was right up at the top - the wonderful old lift took us up to the 5th floor and then we had a flight of stairs, but that wasn't a problem for us. It was an excellent size, nicely decorated and very clean, with a clean modern bathroom as well...and a view of the Eiffel Tower, which made my day. Breakfast was excellent...we ate LOADS and had lighter lunches, one of the best hotel buffets I've had in France. It was included in our room price, not sure how much it would be otherwise. The free internet (accessed by a code we got from reception) was much appreciated. The staff, apart from the slightly snooty bloke on duty late on the Friday night when we checked in, were all very helpful and friendly, and answered all our queries. All in all, can't fault it. Bit of a treat for us, this hotel, but a great stay.,

Reviews.Title: “Great location - shame about the street noise”
Reviews.Author: UkBaz
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back after our stay at the Bradford Elysees (July 2009). The room was nice and spacious as was the bathroom. Our room (24) and bathroom looked as if they had recently been upgraded. Our first night we went to bed around midnight and only managed to have a few hours sleep as the street noise carried on till 6am. The Bradford sits at a cross road with The Bowler pub around the corner. Room 24 sits right on the corner so one of the noisiest rooms to have. In fairness it was only the Saturday night that the noise carried on all night. Monday morning the room right above us must have been under renovation as the workers started banging around 8.30am, so no long lie for us!! The hotel furniture in the lounge looked very used and the sofa was saggy and uncomfortable to sit in for any lenght of time. The staff were friendly, polite and helpful. One word of warning, do not eat or drink at the Monte Cristo on the Champs Elsees. My husband and I had a cup of tea each and my husband had a narghila (hubbly bubbly to me) our bill 50 euro, yes 50!!!!!. We can laugh about it now but what a rip off. We ate at the Chinese and Thai restaurants (down some side streets on the Champs Elysees) most nights as they were reasonably priced. Watch out for the con artists on the Alexandra bridge who pretend to have found a man's gold wedding band, then offer it to you for money. We sat and watched one guy do the same con to every man walking along towards the bridge one day. If I every go back to France I will stay clear of Paris and try some other part of the country.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: tflynnuk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business in December 2008 and was very impressed. The hotel is located on a quiet street with the benefit of being a mere 5 minute walk to the Champs Elysees, 15 minutes to the Eiffel Tower, and within easy reach of numerous Metro lines. The room styles are old fashioned, but immaculate with plenty of character. By contrast the Bathroom was very modern! The room included a large LCD TV and most facilities you would expect from a hotel of this calibre. I did not have much interaction with the staff but check-in and check-out were both painless and took minutes. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone, and will certainly be staying here again for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “The Most trustworthy hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: samirben
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was great location (few minutes to Champs Elysees), great value for the money, large rooms, great staff, very welcoming. But the most important part was the trustworthyness of the hotel: we left the hotel and continued our holidays, it was only 5 days later that my wife realised that she left more than $20.000 worth of jewlery in the safe of the hotel. We called the hotel not knowing what to expect? fortunately the hotel manager Mr. Clayeux kept the jewlery, and was waiting for the right owner to call. Thanks to the manager and the staff, i will always stay in this hotel in Paris, and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “above average”
Reviews.Author: Alfab
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short honeymoon (8 nights) in Paris. The hotel was of a good quality,above average, and the room was great ,we stayed in room 51. Reception - All english speakers and very friendly Room - As i say earlier, the room was great! Spacious, with a great wallpaper(it looks like tapestry),assorted drapes and bed spread, queen bed with good and confortable mattres. The balcony is also nice, well-disposed with some flower pots. The bathroom was also good, clean and looked new. One disadvantage was the shower witch is mounted on the wall and is immovable. Breakfast - We did not tryed the breakfast because we thought it's very expensive(22 euros/pers). You can have breakfast in one of the many cafe's or bistro's placed right near hotel. You have many options between 5 (basic breakfast-coffee,juice and croissant),and 15 (this one it's called gourmand breakfast and includes hot and cold breakfast)euros/pers ,this is only the cheapest and more expensive.Between this 2, there are more options but the review it's for hotel. :) You cant find coffee for a fair price in that area. If you like capuccino , try the cafe latte. It's the same thing,but cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good quality!!”
Reviews.Author: JonnyBoy'H'
Reviews.Content: Have just arrived back from two nights in Paris. We were originally booked into the Best Western Malte Opera and got a phone call about an hour before we were due to leave saying they'd 'upgraded' us to the Bradford Elysee and would charge us the same price but this time would include breakfast. We thought that the hotel was of a good 3* quality overall with the following observations - we stayed in room 52: Reception: We used their local knowledge on several occasions and we could not fault their willingness to help - excellent !! Their English was also of a high standard so, bearing in mind that our French is very basic, we had no communication problems. Room: The usual twin beds pushed together(!) which is a real shame as they could easily have connected these and made them up as a double bed - we did this ourselves instead ! Tea/Coffee Making Facilities: When we arrived, the reception staff asked us if we would like a kettle and they were happy to keep replenishing our stocks of tea and coffee - so no problems here. Bathroom: Excellent standard - clean and looked new but spoiled by the fact that the shower had to be hand held. This could easily have been remedied by having a bracket on the wall. Breakfast: Although this was complimentary for us as part of the upgrade, the quality and choice of the food was poor and the service was even worse !! There were only two staff and they were having real difficulty keeping the tables clean and set for new arrivals. As a result, we had to sit at a dirty table and ask for plates, cups, milk and spoons which all arrived at different times. Another guest asked for some more scrambled egg (as the serving plate was empty) and she was told that 'the eggs are finished'. The guest insisted and the waitress reluctantly went and made some but she was clearly not happy to do this. Bearing in mind it was only 9.45am and breakfast didn't close until 10.30am.......and also that the advertised price for breakfast is 22 euros(!), this was all very reminiscent of Fawlty Towers. In short, more staff, better quality food and a cheaper price would all add up to a better breakfast experience......on reflection take breakfast in one of the many local cafes. Out and About: On the subject of local cafes, take care to search out the good value ones - we paid £5 each (yes!) for coffee at one of the pavement cafes on the Champs Elysee. We found quite a few cafes away from the Champs Elysee that offered coffee for 3 euros - still expensive but that's the euro for you at the moment. Eurostar from Ebbsfleet: In short - the ultimate in convenience and good value for money!! Hope this helps you if you're considering the Bradford Elysee.

Reviews.Title: “You will be very disappointed. Its not 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: CelticTraveller1966
Reviews.Content: This cannot possibly be a 4star hotel. Whilst it is comfortable and faintly quaint, it offers very few of the facilities of a true 4 star hotel. My partner and I stayed in a 'deluxe' room for 3 nights Room 40 on the 4th floor. This is little more than a vey expensive Bed&Breakfast. Restaurant :- None, only a breakfast Room Bar :- None, exccept badly stocked mini bar Room Service :- they have to send out for food and sandwiches, and because of lack of staff even this is a major problem! Furniture&Furnishings :- Basic quality mis-matching Decor :- 6 out of 10 overall Breakfast :- Basic and limited buffet. Expensive at Euro22pppn Rooms :- Spacious but ill equipped and poor decor Trouserpress :- None and not available even when requested Hairdryer :- None In room tea/coffee making facilities :- None, this was particularly important since we had to wait 20 minutes for receptionist to make tea and then we had to bring it up to room ourselves. Room Cleaning/linen/laundry :- Room/linen still not cleaned by 16:00 next day Bathroom :- basic shower in bath format TV - interferance on picture on all and only 6-7 channels. Staff - almost non existant usually only 1-2 in entire hotel at most times Internet - 1 computer in reception lounge credit card payable and not operated by the hotel. Hotel Location - Only 5 minute walk from Champs Elysees but in dreary side street. I cannot understant how this hotel has obtained a 4 star rating nor how Best Western have given it their 'Premier' classification. A clean dry warm hotel but 2.5 star at best. It doesnt even have olde worlde charm to excuse its failings.

Reviews.Title: “kindof scary location and very smelly rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lizzielee
Reviews.Content: While you might look at the location and think it is great because of its proximity to the Arc Du Triumph - note that it is in a somewhat seedy neighborhood with nightclubs that let out at 7am and people walking the streets screeming all night because they are drunk and partying (had to close our windows and could still hear them on the 5th floor) Our room was sooo smelly (of air freshener) that it made me sick - with the windows open it wasnt unbearable but because of the drunk people outside and car alarms we had to close them and then it was horrible again. The weekend we were there, they were painting the hallways and the workmen would leave their paint in the halls with ladders blocking the way - although i'm somewhat of a klutz and am to blame for some of it, i found that my pants, jacket and suitcase were covered in yellow pain by the end of our one night stay. The staff were very sweet and did try to get it out of my coat, the workmen should have been more carefull and i am not sure how long the work will be going on. the room besides being smelly was NOT clean - the blanket was covered in hair, there was hair all over the bathroom floor, the carpet looked like it had not been cleaned since 1988 and the bedspread looked like it had not been washed since 2000. I have to say the room was HUGE and we had french doors that opened up to a super cool balcony! would be great for a party! overall if you can get this for €100 or there abouts i would say for the location and room size it is okay... but four stars... HAAAA there is a giggle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: KimTin
Reviews.Content: My spousse and I stayed in this hotel a couple of years ago and in general our stay was nice. The check in was done fast and since we did not have much knowledge of the guality in forehand we where positively delighted with the nice room given to us. The room was spacious in European standards and we had a comfy kingsize bed. The room was clean and modern and in many ways equal with many 5 star facilities. The location is very good. The hotel is located less than 10 minutes away from the closest metro and C-Elysee. We did not use any additional services of the hotel, but in general the hotel gave a good impression in the level of their service. The cleaning ladies and reception always greeted us with a smile etc. This hotel is a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Another bland, overpriced Paris hotel!”
Reviews.Author: teppy83
Reviews.Content: During my stay in 2006 I remember being thoroughly underwhelmed by this hotel. The room was small and felt damp, amenities were limited and when enquiring about room service at 8pm I was told that unfortunately, the chef had gone home! Not exactly the 'till 11pm' service stated on the menu! On the plus side, the hotel is well placed for the Champs Elysees and other city-centre attractions. The streets between the hotel and the main drag can get a little sketchy at night, but the metro is literally minutes away. The hotel itself has a very Parisian feel - the building is beautiful inside and out - but better options are available for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Reasonably Priced & Well Located!”
Reviews.Author: morganinaboat
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the BW Bradford Premier Elysees for 4 nights during the final weekend of the '07 Tour de France. The property was safe, clean, well located within the city, and I felt the rates were reasonable for Paris at Tour time (imagine hotel prices in your major metro area for the SuperBowl & you get the idea). The bed was decent, sheets were clean, and the bathroom was perfect for my brief stay. Everything seemed tidy with the room and a/c worked fine without being noisy as some reviewers have noted. There was some renovation construction type work underway in the lobby area and that made for some noise during the afternoons, but no problems sleeping during the night. Front desk staff were all very kind and all spoke English well enough to assist me in my travels. 5 minute walk from Rue de St. Honore, & maybe 7 minutes from the Champs Elysees. I was out of there early each AM and didn't sample the offered breakfast. Though, the little Italian bistro next door did offer tasty fare for evening meals. Starbucks was 3 mins away for those that aren't comfortable ordering from a french cafe/bakery. In summary, I have no complaints about this location and would likely stay here again. I did visit with friends who were staying at the Sofitel Le Faubourg & did an event at Le Hotel de Crillon and those were fabulous but VERY pricey. This B-W hotel was great for a quick trip for those that don't need the glizt or glamour but do enjoy being in a terrific location in this great city.

Reviews.Title: “mis-advertised on the best western website!!!”
Reviews.Author: adamant_raf
Reviews.Content: I was very annoyed with my recent stay in this hotel. The name Best Western 'Premier' is very deceiving and you do not get what is advertised! The Best Western website states that the check in time is 1200. I planned my trip so that we would arrive at the hotel at 1215...on our arrival we were told that check in was 1400. My wife and I, sweaty & tired from travelling had to wait for nearly 2 hours to check in. On receiving our room we were amazed at how small the room was, not what we expected! There were no tea/coffee making facilities. The safe didn't even have a lock on it (the lock was missing)! There were only 5 coat hangers unlike the 8 advertised on your website. There was no iron/ironing board as advertised. The curtains didn't shut properly. The air conditioning was very noisy and didn't seem to work. The bedsheet had a stain on it! My wife and I have travelled all over the world and this has got to be the smallest and most mis-advertised room/hotel we have ever stayed in! We did not receive what was advertised or what we expected!

Reviews.Title: “mostly good value for money”
Reviews.Author: goalkeeper
Reviews.Content: I found the comments from previous travellers very useful and accurate in choosing this hotel for the base of our 2 night stay in Paris.Overall the hotel was most satisfactory without having any really outstanding points except maybe the very helpfull front of house staff who certainly did not conform to the usual surly paris stereotype.firstly the hotel is in an excellent location, close to 2 metro stations and no more then 5 minutes walk from the champs elysees. the standard double room was a little on the small side but very clean and pefectly adequate for a short break.the only real criticism was that for a longer stay there was very little drawer or shelf space, so dont bring too many clothes.the bathroom was above average with a good size bath and an efficient shower with plenty of very hot water coming through at a good pressure. We have stayed at several 4 star hotels where the bath takes an eternity to fill! the bed was quite comfortable and the air conditioning worked ok. the public spaces were quite nice with a small lounge and the breakfast room was also quite picturesque. however we were guided by other reviews and booked room only and from what I could see this was good advice as the breakfast looked vastly overpriced.please note there are many cafes and places for breakfast a very short walk from the hotel. We enjoyed dinner 1 night at the bistrot neapolitan on rue franklin rooseveldt just round the corner from the hotel. I know it seems a little perverse eating Italian in Paris but the cost there is very reasonable and the restaurant was full and lively so I would reccomend booking. I had one of the best pizzas I have ever eaten and it was enormous and delicious.Paris was the usual delight especially if you just enjoy wandering around and exploring. the streeets around the marais district are enchanting and also those on the Isle de st. louis.one slightly out of the way walk we took started on the rue moufetard where there is a food market and the road itself is crammed with small food shops selling all sorts of tempting goodies.From there you can walk quickly to the Pantheon where many famous french people such as Marie Curie are burried and from there it is only about 200 metres to the Luxemburg gardens. from there youcan walk into the district of st germain de pres with its great shops cafes and art galleries. it certanly made a great trip for a few hours.In conclusion I would not put anyone off staying at the hotel but dont expect too much. we paid about 160 euros per night and I would say any more and it would have been slightly overpriced. having said that Paris is not a cheap city although these days probably no more expensive then London. Perhaps I better start looking for another holiday again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique”
Reviews.Author: RoboPop
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here three nights over the weekend. Its an older boutique but well cared for. It is situated in a good spot, is about three blocks from the Champs Elysees and two blocks from the Metro. There are some nearby night clubs which stayed open quite late on Friday. On the other nights, all seemed to close down by eleven. Our room (Number 11) appeared to be recently updated and was huge. We had large double windows that were floor to ceiling and the bathroom was large. This hotel had a nice Parisian feel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Stay”
Reviews.Author: kennybase
Reviews.Content: Having booked this from ---.com a few days before flying out to Paris for the weekend, I wasn't too sure what to expect. Got a taxi from CDG to the hotel for 45Euros taking about 30min, and checked in just before midnight. Very welcoming staff throughout the whole stay. We were given room 2 which is on ground floor which we weren't too happy with to start with, but as hotel was full we could only change for the second night. Once we got in the room was very spacious and a lot quieter than we thought it would be so we stayed there for 2 nights. The location of the hotel is perfect too - a few min walk to Champs Elysees, not far to the nearest Metro (although the closest one in shut until middle of Feb 2007) and the area is safe to walk about in at night. Fully recommend this place, and will be staying again in the future.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Bradford Elysees
HotelInfo.Address: 10, rue Saint Philippe du Roule | 75008 PARIS, 75008 Paris, France
